intro: Karpatiosorbus veszpremensis, commonly known as the Veszprém sorbus, is a rare shrub native to the Carpathian Basin. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its dense, rounded growth habit. The plant produces small, white flowers in clusters, followed by red, fuzzy berries that are a distinctive feature. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
